definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]
strong smell of gunpowder/fig. tense situation/standoff

sentences.english: If so, you've got a powder keg.
sentences.chinese: 倘若果真如此，这个人就像一个正在形成的火药桶。

sentences.english: The Gunpowder Plot of 1605 was the most famous of the Catholic conspiracies.
sentences.chinese: 1605年的火药阴谋案是最著名的天主教阴谋。

sentences.english: The black lift powder at the base catapults the shell into the air.
sentences.chinese: 底部起到推进作用的黑火药负责将烟花壳送入空中。

sentences.english: The most famous of the Catholic compiracies was the Gunpowder plot of 1605.
sentences.chinese: 最著名的天主教阴谋是1605年的火药阴谋案。

sentences.english: Gunpowder was the lineal successor of the Greek fire.
sentences.chinese: 火药是希腊火的直接衍生物。

sentences.english: Kuguan member Liu Xinghua transformation of the powder keg full of praise.
sentences.chinese: 库管员刘兴华对火药库改造赞不绝口。

sentences.english: Factories making fire-crackers and fireworks or gunpowder.
sentences.chinese: 三爆竹烟火工厂及火药类制造工作场所。

sentences.english: In olden times one had to charge a musket before firing.
sentences.chinese: 以前必须先给步枪装上火药才能开枪。

sentences.english: Gunpowder changed the rules of war.
sentences.chinese: 火药改变了战争的规则。

sentences.english: I can smell the gunpowder all the way up here in the cockpit.
sentences.chinese: 一路上我都可以从驾驶舱里闻到火药味。

sentences.english: Dublin city is currently like a tinderbox just waiting to explode.
sentences.chinese: 都柏林市现在就像一个马上要爆炸的火药桶。

sentences.english: An Alchemists ' Guild house notably improves the experience level of gunpowder units trained in the same settlement.
sentences.chinese: 炼金大师行会明显提高城邑中火药部队的作战经验。

sentences.english: They had to carry a ramrod as well as powder and ball.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须带上推弹杆以及火药和子弹。

sentences.english: It was a day of tense and often ill- tempered debate.
sentences.chinese: 那天的辩论紧张激烈，常常火药味十足。

sentences.english: Bear hunters used as much gunpowder as possible.
sentences.chinese: 猎熊的人尽量多装火药。

definition: firearms (in historical context)/flintlock (old powder and shot firearm)
big gun/cannon/artillery/one who talks big/trad. form 大炮 also used/CL:門|门[men2],尊[zun1]
